items.title: Generic container for items in a dataset
items.description: A JSON array or object property containing one or more items in a dataset or data structure within a dataset.

title: GAP Species Summary Collection
description: A dataset containing the results of a search for Gap Analysis Project Species in ScienceBase. The process assembles several collections of details about the species for further analysis and other uses.

Name Source.title: Name Source
Name Source.description: A label for the source of scientific name used in the query.

GAP Species.title: The Gap species Schema
GAP Species.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

GAP Habitat Map Item.title: Habitat Map Item Link
GAP Habitat Map Item.description: A link to the ScienceBase Item containing the species habitat map for the GAP species.

GAP Range Map Item.title: Range Map Item Link
GAP Range Map Item.description: A link to the ScienceBase Item containing the species range map for the GAP species.

GAP Habitat Map WMS.title: GAP Habitat Map WMS
GAP Habitat Map WMS.description: The URL for the Web Map Service for the GAP habitat map.

GAP Modeling Database Parameters URL.title: GAP Modeling Database Parameters Link
GAP Modeling Database Parameters URL.description: The file download link for the GAP species modeling database parameters.

GAP ITIS Information URL.title: GAP ITIS Information Link
GAP ITIS Information URL.description: The file download link for a data structure containing information on the ITIS taxonomic record associated with the GAP species.

GAP Habitat Map File Size.title: GAP Habitat Map File Size
GAP Habitat Map File Size.description: The size in bytes of the habitat map zipped GeoTIFF for the GAP species

GAP Habitat Map Last Updated.title: Habitat Map Last Updated
GAP Habitat Map Last Updated.description: Date/time that the habitat map item was last updated.

GAP_SpeciesCode.title: GAP Species Code
GAP_SpeciesCode.description: Unique, persistent internal identifier for the GAP species.

nsid_acceptedMatch.title: Nature Serve Identifier
nsid_acceptedMatch.description: A unique, persistent identifier to a related species record in the NatureServe Species Database.

iucn_id_verified.title: IUCN Red List Identifier
iucn_id_verified.description: A unique, persistent identifier to a related species record in the International Union for the Conservation of Science (IUCN) Red List.

GAP Range Map WMS.title: GAP Range Map WMS
GAP Range Map WMS.description: The URL for the OGC Web Mapping Service for the GAP species range map.

Range Bounding Box.title: Range Bounding Box
Range Bounding Box.description: The bounding box coordinates for the species range.

GAP Modeling Database Parameters.title: Gap Modeling Database Parameters
GAP Modeling Database Parameters.description: This data object contains the full set of modeling parameters for the GAP species. It is a direct import of the 'Machine Readable Habitat Database Parameters' file released with the habitat map.

doi.title: The Doi Schema
doi.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

input_layers.title: Input Layers
input_layers.description: This data object provides the digital object identifiers for each of the input data layers used in the spatial habitat mapping process for the subject GAP species. More details about the modeling and mapping process can be found in this ScienceBase Item - https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/527d0a83e4b0850ea0518326. Individual property values here are somewhat shorthand and will be improved with better information and associated references over time.

intEdgeEcoWidth.title: The Intedgeecowidth Schema
intEdgeEcoWidth.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

strEdgeType.title: The Stredgetype Schema
strEdgeType.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

sb_url.title: ScienceBase Item UDR
sb_url.description: Link to the ScienceBase Item for the habitat map.

models.title: Models
models.description: This data structure contains the actual input parameters used in the modeling workflow to determine the applicable habitats within range and other constraints. Each species will have a different property name here based on the species code and may have more than one set of input variables depending on how the regional modeling process was conducted.

.*.title: Modeling Input Parameters
.*.description: A set of modeling input parameters for a GAP species.

references.title: References
references.description: The literature references cited by the modeler used in developing the model parameters for the subject species.

examples: Lannoo, M. 2005. M. Lannoo (Ed.), Amphibian Declines. The Conservation Status of United States Species, University of California Press, Berkeley, CA (2005), p. 1094

Good, D. A., and D. B. Wake. 1992. Geographic variation and speciation in the torrent salamanders of the genus Rhyacotriton (Caudata: Rhyacotritonidae). University of California Publications in Zoology, Number 126, University of California, Berkeley, California.

habitat_description.title: Habitat Description
examples: This species of torrent salamander occur only towards the west slopes of the Cascade Mountains from the west bank of the Skookumchuck River in central Washington, near the Thurston-Lewis County line (McAllister 1995; Green et al. 2013). In Oregon, this species occurs south to the Middle Fork of the Willamette River (Good and wake 1992; Lannoo 2005). Stebbins (2003) noted occurrences in Skamania County, Washington, and Lane County in Oregon. Elevational range for this species is varied, but not entirely understood; populations have been reported at 1219 meters, but most have been studied at around 870 meters (Good and Wake 1992; Lannoo 2005). It is important to note that Cascade torrent salamanders are usually not reported downstream, where gradients are lower and present fewer opportunities for suitable habitat (Hunter 1998). Previous research on larval density in the Columbia River gorge, found the Cascade torrent salamander to have one of the highest density in comparison to any other Rhyacotriton salamander averaging 33.3 larvae/m2 (Nussbaum and Tait 1977). Adults at the same locality by Wahkeena Falls averaged 1.9 adults/m2 (Nijhuis and Kaplan 1998). Egg deposition sites are associated with coarse substrate spaces in slow velocity flow seeps. Larvae have been reported under stones along stream channels and in fissure networks found in the streambed and bank (Nussbaum and Tait 1977). As adults, preferred habitat includes underground water courses, rocky rubble found in stream banks, fissures by stream banks, and cracks in wet cliffs (Leonard et al. 1993; Corkran and Thoms 1996). Maximum size of basins where torrent salamanders were reported was 141 ha (348 ac; Hunter 1998).

taxonomic.title: Taxonomic Identifiers for the Species
taxonomic.description: Contains a group of direct or related taxonomic identifiers for the subject GAP species.

GAP ITIS Information.title: GAP ITIS Information
GAP ITIS Information.description: Contains a cache of information pulled directly from the ITIS API for the TSN associated with the species. Without a date/time stamp in the data, this information should not be considered current but may be considered an assertion of taxonomy agreed to be the modeler. It's not clear which API for ITIS was used, but the query parameters may refer to the ITIS Solr API.

responseHeader.title: responseHeader
responseHeader.description: HTTP response header recorded for the API response.

response.title: The Response Schema
response.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

hierarchyTSN.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.
